sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"调查，检查"之意。
means: examine ： 最普通用词，可指粗略地查看，也可指仔细观察或调查以确定事物的性质、功能、特点等。
inspect ： 侧重按一定质量标准检查某物，找出不足或不同之处。
investigate ： 指为发现事实真相或了解掌握情况而进行深入细致的现场考察。
scan ： 原义是仔细地检查分析，现用于指细看或浏览。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"读，阅读"之意。
means: read ： 最普通用词，含义广泛。既指朗读又可指默读。
devor ： 指贪婪地读，暗含对某些作者或作品迷恋之义。
scan ： 指快速扫视文章等以抓住其要旨。

word_mean: 闪烁扫描，扫描：为scintiscan的简写。根据不同受检器官，有各种不同的设计，如脑扫描、肾扫描、甲状腺扫描等
回声探测显示法：A型超声在阴极射线管上显示回波脉冲，其中一个轴代表回波反射所需的时间，另一轴代表回波脉冲强度。B型超声中，阴级射线管上光点的位置代表回波脉冲消逝的时间，且光点的亮度与回波脉冲强度成正比。超声波探头(换能器)在体表移动则产生二维截面图像

sentence.Network_en: I just had a quick scan through your book again.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只是又快速浏览了一遍你的书。

sentence.Network_en: He was rushed to hospital for a brain scan.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被火速送往医院做脑部扫描。

sentence.Network_en: Their approach is to scan every checked-in bag with a bomb detector.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的方法是用炸弹探测器对每一个办理了登机手续的箱包进行扫描。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb in sense 2): from Latin scandere 'climb' (in late Latin 'scan (verses'), by analogy with the raising and lowering of one's foot when marking rhythm. From 'analyse (metre') arose the senses 'estimate the correctness of' and 'examine minutely', which led to 'look at searchingly' (late 18th cent.)

entry.def: When you scan written material, you look through it quickly in order to find important or interesting information.

example.ex: She scanned the advertisement pages of the newspapers...
example.tran: 她浏览了一下报纸的广告页。

example.ex: I haven't read much into it as yet. I've only just scanned through it.
example.tran: 我还没有细细研读，只是粗略地翻看了一下。

entry.def: When you scan a place or group of people, you look at it carefully, usually because you are looking for something or someone.

example.tran: 那名警官仔细检查了房间。

example.ex: She was nervous and kept scanning the crowd for Paul...
example.tran: 她很紧张，眼睛不停地在人群中搜寻保罗。

entry.def: If people scan something such as luggage, they examine it using a machine that can show or find things inside it that cannot be seen from the outside.

example.ex: Their approach is to scan every checked-in bag with a bomb detector.
example.tran: 他们的方法是用炸弹探测器对每一个办理了登机手续的箱包进行扫描。

entry.def: If a computer disk is scanned, a program on the computer checks the disk to make sure that it does not contain a virus.

example.ex: The disk has no viruses — I've scanned it already.
example.tran: 这个盘没有感染病毒——我已经扫描过了。

entry.def: If a picture or document is scanned into a computer, a machine passes a beam of light over it to make a copy of it in the computer.

example.ex: The entire paper contents of all libraries will eventually be scanned into computers...
example.tran: 所有图书馆的全部纸质内容最终都会被扫描进电脑。

example.ex: Designs can also be scanned in from paper.
example.tran: 设计图也可以从纸上扫描进电脑。

entry.def: If a radar or sonar machine scans an area, it examines or searches it by sending radar or sonar beams over it.

example.ex: The ship's radar scanned the sea ahead.
example.tran: 船上的雷达扫描了前方的海域。

entry.def: A scan is a medical test in which a machine sends a beam of X-rays over a part of your body in order to check that it is healthy.

example.ex: He was rushed to hospital for a brain scan.
example.tran: 他被火速送往医院做脑部扫描。

example.ex: ...a breast scan to check for cancer.
example.tran: 为诊察癌症所做的乳腺扫描检查

entry.def: If a pregnant woman has a scan, a machine using sound waves produces an image of her womb on a screen so that a doctor can see if her baby is developing normally.
If a line of a poem does not scan, it is not the right length or does not have emphasis in the right places to match the rest of the poem.

example.ex: He had written a few poems. Sid told him they didn't scan.
example.tran: 他写了几首诗。锡德告诉他那几首诗都不押韵。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of scanning; systematic examination of a prescribed region;

sentences.sentence: "he made a thorough scan of the beach with his binoculars"
"you could see the tumor in the CAT scan"
"She scanned the newspaper headlines while waiting for the taxi"

means.word_mean: 3. make a wide, sweeping search of;
5. move a light beam over; in electronics, to reproduce an image

Sentence.sentence: Some law firms now use artificial intelligence software to scan and read mountains of legal documents, work that previously was performed by highly-paid human lawyers.

Outside the US, Google has made sure only to scan books that are out of copyright and thus in the "public domain" (works such as the Bodleian's first edition of Middle march, which anyone can read for free on Google Books Search).
So far, Google has scanned more than 10 million titles from libraries in America and Europe - including half a million volumes held by the Bodleian in Oxford.

means.word_mean: 细查, 审视, 观测, 严密监视

sentences.en: The detective scanned every bit of evidence.
sentences.cn: 侦探仔细检查了每一样证据。

sentences.en: She scanned his face to see if he was telling the truth.
sentences.cn: 她审视着他的脸, 看他讲的是否是真话。

sentences.en: I scanned the newspaper for the information I needed.
sentences.cn: 我浏览报纸寻找自己需要的信息。

sentences.en: This apparatus scans patients' brains for tumours.
sentences.cn: 这台仪器扫描检查病人的脑瘤。

sentences.en: The first scan was bad, so I had to do it again.
sentences.cn: 第一次扫描不好, 所以我得重做。

jushi.english: The second line of that verse doesn't scan properly.
jushi.chinese: 那首诗的第二行不符合格律。

jushi.english: The flashlight's beam scanned every corner of the room.
jushi.chinese: 手电的光束扫掠了房间的每一个角落。

jushi.english: The radar was scanning the sky.
